intro: Delissea laciniata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved delissea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and prolonged blooming period.
